properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Marshall. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Town of Marshall water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-09-20T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Marshall, 2019-09-16T17:02:45-06:00, 2498F710-D435-4E8F-9510-C0CC3D7BF9EB
Area: Town of Marshall
properties.Author: SK Marshall

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain and thunderstorms are expected this evening and overnight. Rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm are possible. Hail is also possible within these storms. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T11:14:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T19:15:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0294674619.2019
Area: Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Lookout - Eastern Lac Seul, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are expected to continue to develop this afternoon and may last into this evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T04:59:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T17:25:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1928824811.2019
Area: Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:24 p.m. EST (4:24 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts. This severe thunderstorm is located 46 kilometres south of Quetico Provincial Park, moving northeast at 40 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-17T23:19:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T20:25:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1637890754.2019
Area: Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. Smoke plumes moving over the Mayo region from forest fires in the Yukon will continue today. Air quality may deteriorate if the smoke descends to ground level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-09-18T00:27:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon, 2019-09-17T12:18:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1586655938.2019
Area: Mayo
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop below the freezing mark in these areas overnight tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T11:30:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T19:31:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3498696567.2019
Area: Forestville area, Les Escoumins area, Mont-Joli area, Le Bic - Rimouski area, Rimouski Wildlife Reserve area, Matane, Amqui area, Matapédia area, New-Richmond - Bonaventure area, Restigouche - Carleton area, Baie-Comeau, Baie-Trinité area, Sept-Îles - Port-Cartier area, Minganie, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area, Trois-Pistoles area, Pohénégamook area, Kamouraska area, Rivière-du-Loup area, Témiscouata
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are crossing the Ontario-Minnesota border this afternoon into the evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-09-18T07:01:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T19:16:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3119809578.2019
Area: Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update For The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Town Of Lampman
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory that has been issued for the Town of Lampman. This update is to expand the area of the advisory to also include the 100 block of 1st Ave. E. due to fire hydrant replacements. The advisory area is for residents of the Town of Lampman on the following streets: 1st St. N from 3rd Ave. to 5th Ave. E., 3rd Ave. E from 1st St. S. to Corrigan Road and 1st Ave. E. from Main St. to Corrigan Road.
Expires: 2019-09-25T16:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK City of Estevan, Town of Lampman, RM of Browning, 2019-09-16T16:28:09-06:00, A7B63B05-67DF-5188-B8C2-FD99216D379B
Area: Town of Lampman
properties.Author: SK City of Estevan, Town of Lampman, RM of Browning

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will allow ground temperatures to cool to near or below zero over many regions of New Brunswick tonight. Similar conditions are likely again Wednesday night. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T10:52:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T18:53:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2099732472.2019
